name: Blues and Bullets
description: Blues and Bullets is a dark and violent crime thriller. Set in an alternative Eliot Ness & Al Capone story, Blues and Bullets blends a stunning script with detective work to deliver an amazing interactive experience.

reviews.review_text: The main character is voiced by Geralt of Rivia. What else could you want?

At first it's about finding Al Capone's granddaughter.  Then they go to same café, where every video game character are waiting for their Episode 3  Did Gabe Newell buy the rights of Blues and Bullets or what?  The first two episodes were great, but it has been 8 months since 2nd episode came out. And Developer went silent for their customers + their website no longer exist. So I think this game now turned into dead project
If you adore Crime/Thriller then this is the game for you.  9/10 perfecto!
I can't wait for next episodes. And many thanks to the devs for the PT-Br subtitles.  A fine work that worth the price without discount.

A good start. Flawed? Yes. But I like the presentation, the story, and the mechanics. I'd like to see investigation tackled in greater detail, mind, but I'm more of a Frogwares fans than a Telltale fan, so we'll see.  All in all, I'd definitely want to see where this is heading.

I'm pleased to report - well worth the money.   A short, linear adventure, B&B scratched my itch for story-driven goodness this summer. The staples of the genre are here: broken people, dry wit, dizzying camera angles, visual metaphors and grisly murders, all painted in black and white and red. A close point of comparison theme-wise for me are Heavy Rain and LA Noire, while True Detective seems to also be an inspiration for some quirkier ideas.   There's no open world or minigames here - we get the good old Telltale formula and its main strengths are characters, noir-dialogue gems and moody atmosphere. This first episode is short, but packs in quite a lot of content and twists to satisfy.The lead actor is the same as Geralt of Rivia. Try it, you'll like it!

Blues and Bullets is a neat interactive movie in the vein of Life is Strange and 1979 Revolution. The tone is far more fantastic, though. You play a retired cop in a dieselpunk alternate history who gets pulled back into a case, and it's a bloody one. As appears to be the norm with these sorts of games, the controls are absolutely wretched. It's particularly bad in this game due to certain sequences where you need to be very precise; be prepared to spend ages playing the accordion on WASD and randomly waving your mouse around trying to get your crosshair in the sweet spot. If the controls don't make you rage-quit first, you'll enjoy a fairly interesting storyline and an inspired take on the hard-boiled Frank Miller aesthetic. Certainly worth giving the first episode a shot if you're into detective stories or urban fantasy. I'll be getting the season pack.
A great first chapter! Everyone should try this game, I really can´t wait for the second chapter, hurry up guys, please! :)

I just found this one by accident - didn't know it existed.  Now i must ask myself: Why didn't i recognize this wonderful work of art before? :-)  It's a Mafia/Horror story with a unique style closely to sin city with just the right atmosphere. It's about investigation, making decisions, it has Aspects of Shooters and Quick Time Event fighting and you have the feeling of watching an extremely cool movie (great visuals !).  AND you can play it in linux ;-)  I *really* like it. 10/10!
Very mysterious story and good artstyle, looking forward for next episodes.

I usually don't post reviews about games. Steam, Metacritic or anywhere. From the first episode that I have played all I can say is that if you enjoy games like Telltale where you have to wait for the next episodes to come out like a tv show you will love it. This like Telltale gives you the option to say whatever you want through 2-4 choices. The graphics may not be Unreal Engine 4 material, but it brings something else to the table that most games don't. It's only colors can be seen is in black, white and red. The art style is really cool and nicely detailed. This game is a game where your not fully into it because of the beginning but, in the middle or towards the end. In which I felt the same way watching Breaking Bad. It felt a little slow in the beginning but, it picked up after things started to make sense. Once you learn the plot and character along side the setting you will be more then just hooked on this game. The beginning is slow for a reason and a good one too. I saw this the first day it started to sell on steam. I checked it out then bought it earlier today. All I can say is that this game has a nice story to follow along to and it will get more interesting as the other episodes come out. The good thing out of this game was now I can say I spent my money well and can't wait for the future of this game. Good job to “A Crowd of Monsters” and Yes I definitly suggest that you should buy “Blues and Bullets” not just episode 1 but, the complete season.

First episode is great. I wasn't as engaged in a story after only the first episode in any of the episodic games I have played. And I've played all Telltale games and Life is Strange - titles that got much more applause and recognition. Blues and Bullets started really great and I can't wait for the next episode.

Excellenet start of the game series. Quality graphic, superb sound, music and voice action (main hero is the voice of Geralt from Witcher 3) and outstanding story. I hope the guys will continue with such a quality in the next episodes.

This is something that you're not expect from a studio like this. Really an atmospheric, original story with a 'Sin city' style. The only thing that isn't good about this game is a face-animation, but it won't annoy you in any way.

I really enjoyed the first episode of this series and I'm actually really excited to see how the rest plays out. The story was very engaging and was the equivalent of a book that makes you keep saying 'one more page'. The voice acting, in my opinion, was very good, the added gameplay elements other than just dialouge selection were an added bonus, the music was incredibly well done, visually I think the game is beautiful, and for the most part the animations were fantastic.  The only real quarrals I have with the game is that some of the animations (mainly facial) could have been done a little better. I also felt like the base movement speed for your character is a little slow. I can't imagine anybody walks that slow in real life, however there is a button for a 'jog' which helps but there are portions of the game where you're forced to walk at his slow speed.  Overall I really enjoyed the first episode and like I said I can't wait for the other episodes to actually be released because I like where the story is going. I'd also like to add that the game reminded me of the movie Sin City so if you like that movie you'll probably enjoy this. So finally my actual rating for the first episode would be a solid 9/10 I highly recommend checking this episodic game out!
Beware of the Linux-version!  Ep. 1 has serious controller issues, and it seems, that the Devs won't fix them.  There is even no version for Linux for Ep. 2 and up!

If you like any of the TellTale games, especially The Wolf Among Us, you'll really enjoy this. The story starts the setup with the quintessential noir setup, but if you aren't familiar with the tropes, don't worry. Even if you are, things get a little different. This game has a few flaws, including the semi-locked camera angle, mistimed dialogue with character animation and some of the quick-time events are a little too quick. But these are minor gripes, with solid acting, gorgeous animation, and decent writing. But above all, the soundtrack really gets you. Definitely looking forward to seeing this game evolve.

I have only played the first episode but so far it's been an excellent game. Noir adventures are my jam but even if you aren't a fan of the genre I'd recommend this for the incredible graphics, music and story. The game starts off in a suspenseful situation and you're given the whole timed decision consequence scenario that is well known among Tell Tale games. Though I haven't really seen any deviation in how the story plays out through different choices. The story plays out rather quickly as you can be in a calm conversation in one episode then thrust into a fight some couple minutes later.   There's a few gun fights that play out simply in an aim and shoot, also featured are a few quick time action events. And if by chance you do happen to die the game is very forgiving and restarts right before the event. In addition there are also detective-esque moments where you will have to piece together what happened at a crime scene. There isn't any side quest deviation but you do have branching paths of Eliot Ness and another individual which slowly become connected.  Despite the monotone graphic style with sparing use of red there are incredibly detailed and vibrant environments.The episode played out in just over 2 hours and the game does leave you at a bit of a cliffhanger at the end but it gives you enough stuff packed in the episode so that it's never boring. The music and voice acting also does a great job of getting into the feel of the era. It's as polished a game as you would expect from any of the top tier developers. I did experience a little bit of lag at certain areas but nothing that hindered my playing too much. With the intriguing plot this game and stunning visuals you'll be happy about trying this one.

The game can be a little rough around the edges and the gameplay is very simplistic, however if you're seeking a dark noir detective / adventure game and enjoy the aesthetics of Sin City or other similar graphics with a heavy dose of the macabre and occult, you will probably dig this. Some of the character animations can be a little rough, and the facial expressions inparticular look a bit dated, but overall it's an enjoyable, immersive, dark story. It is episodic however, and as of 11/22/2015 only one episode has been released thus far. The release timeline of further episodes seems a bit slow..
I love this game. Waiting for the other three episodes!

Ok I really love this game so I am going to start with my slight niggles.............weird I know but they are so small I may as well get them out of the way first.  Ocassionally it feels like a mouse look option would be nice.  When you get game badge cards etc awarded through steam it killed the game a couple of times for me. Not a big issue though as it only happened on auto save points anyways, so I lost only a few seconds to reload the game and that was maybe down to my hardware not just the game.  On the PLUS points...........  If you like LA Noire this has definitely taken a huge influence from that game. The puzzles are a lot easier and more linear.... For me that did not matter and for this game was probably a bonus. The reason why is that this game is also a lot like Tell Tale games. You are playing through a set story. Whilst there are choices to make its really just about the quality of the story telling and the story in this game.   For those who have seen the untouchables or know about Al Capone and Elliot Ness the alternate history of them working togtether should be a very appealing storyline in it self.  Graphically its like playing your way through Sin City and anybody who dosnt like that idea must be not just colour blind but BLIND! Its done extremely well.   The voice acting is great and soundtrack fits the feel of the game immensly well.  I bought episode 1 on sale for £1.99 and it took around 2 hours to finish on a casual play through with a couple of beers and a glass of good whisky....... Money well spent I felt like I was playing a £30 title and cant wait for the next episode.  Overall I'd give this 9 out 10. Extremely suprised by the overall quality and finish of this game.   Try it , especially while its on sale for £1.99 its a no brainer, enjoy :-)

I like the game - it's like LA Noire with Telltale's style.  Bought the season pass a year ago and eps 3 - 5 seems got a heavy delay. There's a lot of rumor that the game would be cancel because season pass is pulled out from the store. The dev claimed that the development is still going on, but the lack of communication from the dev (at least give us an ETA) making me disappointed.  Thank God, I got full refund from Steam.  For now on, it's not recommended. I still put this on a whistlist. I'm looking forward to buy this again once they have a complete game.

I have just finished the first episode and I must say, I AM HOOKED! This game is chilling and enthralling. I had a fantastic time playing it.  The art style is just beautiful, the music is amazing and the voice acting is brillaint. I would definetly recommend this to anyone who likes games like 'the wolf among us' and is fond of Noir/hardboiled thrillers.  Though it must be said that this game can be quite confronting at times.  I can't wait for the next episode!  UPDATE: Episode 2!  I have just finished the second episode. Wow just wow! I loved it. If you think it can't get much more disturbing you have another thing coming! The music and the atmosphere is just as good as the first episode and the story line has progressed nicely. I never know which choice will cause the least problems for the children, seriously it's just evil. WHY? WHY ARE YOU DOING THIS? WHO ARE YOU?!!!! I cant wait for the mystery to be resolved!   I must be honest, I dislike how long it has taken the developer to release the second episode. I understand these things happen and some times games are delayed but it has almost been a year since the first episode was released.  I can't wait for the next episode! Heres hoping it wont take another eight months.
Interesting story if you are into dectective and mystery type

This is an immersive and gritty film noir interactive detective story centered around the occult, a series of mysterious child kidnappings, and an alternative relationship between Eliot Ness and Al Capone. The detective scenes where you determine various elemants of the crime and select clues to use as evidence to complete the breakdown of the crime are interesting and exciting. It makes clever use of a crime board as your evidence map, complete with pins and string to show links. It has elements of L.A. Noire and other Film Noir Genre games.  It is a dark, gritty interactive detective comic with an art style reminiscient of old detective comics in the black and white, with colour thrown in occasionally to show important things like blood and fire. Help Al Capone find his granddaughter in the aftermath of his incarceration, whilst using contacts in the police and new contacts in the mafia. Hunt down a serial killer obsessed with the occult and enjoy cutaway scenes of    playing as Sofia in the Cultist lair, slowly learning more about them.

Okay so to start of this review let's just say that I originally thought 'Eh once you've played a telltale game you've played all there is to play of this genre.'. Well if I had a time machine and duct tape I would go back in time to that moment and tape my mouth shut. This game is a story telling masterpiece thus far, Episode 1 left me wanting more with it's unique twists and turns. Now with all of the things this game gets right it does get some things wrong so lets talk about those the first thing is the graphics/optimization. This game runs on the unity engine and that probably wasn't the best choice, but even in light of that fact it looks decent. The only problem is that if you're like me and have a 4k monitor you aren't going to be able to play it in 4k resolution. I'm sure that the devs are working to better optimize this game, but as of this review that is a problem. Another slight problem is the camera and the controls the camera is fixed and this is fine, but sometimes it causes the controls to act and feel a bit clunky there was one section in episode one at the docks where the camera bugged and it caused the main character that you control to walk backwards (Even though I was pressing the walk forwards key) until he got unstuck. Like I said the problems that exist are small and easily dealt with, but I feel like they are worth mentioning. Last thing I'll mention in this game is the art design even on the dinky 1920 x 1080p resolution I'm playing it on, the greyscale/monochrome (there are some reds but mostly black and white) is just beautiful the overall art design in this game is fantastic, but at the same time I feel that it's held back immensely due to the unity engine. other last thing (I lied in the last sentence) I feel that it's worth mentioning that this game does a better job in my opinion than telltale does in providing some in between options for some of the necessary choices in the game and I like that and I think telltale could (To quote telltale's the walking dead season 1) take a page out of Blues and Bullets' book. So to wrap this up I don't recommend many games, but if you're like me and are truly obsessed with the Noire genre and pay more attention to story rather than graphics I would reccomend buying this game.

I really enjoyed what I did play, but I wanted to hold off until more episodes came down the line. Looks like that is not happening. Avoid this game until the devs do anything regarding it. Save your money and your time.

I'm hooked for episode two. The animation and lip syncing isn't great but I enjoyed the dectective sequence, the mystery story and the visuals have a lot of pop. Very interested to see how things unfold.

i loved the style of the game and the story is good but i have my issues. yes i do understand its a 'what if?' story but i hate when they take gangster theme games and make them bigger than life. like the giant floating hotel and the one man army scene against capones men. you dont see things like that in real life mafia scenarios and it bothers me that for people like me who know facts about capones and ness life that we see him drunk taking a whole army single handed. Also soe of the voice acting is off, the animation sometimes is really bad, especially the mouths. over all the story is great if you get by the loose facts and grandious sets. music is amazing too, i would recomend if you are looking for a good story and a very stylish game.

Very interesting game. It has a 'home made', 'feel good' vibe. I LOVED it. And I am very curious to see how the story unfolds.   MUST play if you like adventure games in the veins of Telltale's games.

Straight line walking sim with no actual depth, with an episode that can be completed under two hours.

I loved the first 2 episodes of this game. The story has been amazing so far, it offers a unique story with twists and turns and the use of historical entities in a fantasy scenario has been fun. The black and white with red works well with the setting of the game and graphically I love the style they used. The voice acting is pretty decent too. Gameplay is fairly similar to something like the TellTale series, where it has limited options and controls. But it's still a fun game and the story and art style keeps me glued to the game until I binge the entire episode in one sitting.  With all of these GREAT elements though lies a HUGE issue... You may never get to finish the story. Episode releases are near non-existent, with one every 6 months or so. I loved the game so much that I could have lived with this, if only the devs would keep us updated. But the devs lack of communication have made me think that this game is most likely abandon or in limbo now with rumors that some of the artists ect. have left the team. I got so frustrated and felt ripped off that I asked for a refund on my season pass and after alot of scratching and clawing with Steam support finally got one...  If you want to start a fairly decent game with an interesting story and graphical scheme and don't mind that you may never get to finish the story... It might be worth checking out, because I have enjoyed the first 2 episodes. But if you do get it, personally I'd suggest getting just episode 1 and episode 2, avoid the season pass atleast until more episodes are released because at this point there's a chance that you'll never see the final 3 episodes.
